build.pull_request_title: [FLINK-9253][network] make the maximum floating buffers count channel-type independent

commit.message:
[FLINK-9253][network] work around input gate buffer counts depending on known input channel types

If we don't know the channel type yet, i.e. there is an UnknownInputChannel, we
would use unused exclusive buffers for the floating buffer pool but as soon as
an unknown channel is changed to a remote channel, we'd have to revoke those
buffers and use them as exclusive buffers. Since revoking buffers may be a
blocking task, we go the other way around and reserve exclusive buffers for
unknown input channels as well and either return them to the pool (for local
channels) or use them as exclusive buffers (for remote channels).

TODO: some more tests for the added functionality
